channel.title: Sofía Álvarez-López

item.title: About me
item.description: I’m a Physics Ph.D. candidate at MIT working with Professor Salvatore Vitale on gravitational-wave astrophysics and data analysis. I use Bayesian methods to study the properties and evolution of black hole and neutron star populations in the Universe. At MIT, I’m part of the LIGO Laboratory (Laser Interferometer Gravitational-wave Observatory) and the MIT Kavli Institute for Astrophysics and Space Research. I’m grateful to be supported by the Thomas A. Frank Fellowship (2023–2024), the Mario Santo Domingo Fellowship (2024–2025), and the ACM SIGHPC Data Science Fellowship (2025–present).
